vocabulary.definition: To perceive with the eyes; to observe.

examples.tausug: Kita ku kaw ha iskul kagabii.
examples.english: I saw you at school yesterday.

vocabulary.notes: Different meaning from the pronoun 'kita' (we inclusive).

vocabulary.definition: To move at a speed faster than a walk.

examples.tausug: Dagan siya bang mangadjat in ulan.
examples.english: He runs when the rain starts.

vocabulary.definition: To change position or go from one place to another.
To rest in a state of reduced consciousness.

examples.tausug: Tulug na aku kay' kapuyan na.
examples.english: I'm going to sleep now because I'm tired.

vocabulary.definition: To put food into the mouth and chew and swallow it.
vocabulary.notes: Same spelling as the noun 'kaun' (food/meal) but different function.

vocabulary.definition: To take liquid into the mouth and swallow.
To look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter.

examples.tausug: Bassa aku sin libro kada adlaw.
examples.english: I read a book every day.

vocabulary.definition: To mark letters, words, or other symbols on a surface.

examples.tausug: Sulat ku in ngan ku ha katas.
examples.english: I write my name on the paper.

vocabulary.definition: To move from one place to another on foot.
To get on or into a vehicle for transportation.

examples.tausug: Sakay kita sin kappal pa Jolo.
examples.english: Let's ride the ship to Jolo.

vocabulary.definition: To carry or transport something to a destination.

examples.tausug: Hatud ku in regalu ha kumpanyu.
examples.english: I will bring the gift to my friend.

vocabulary.definition: To make it easier for someone to do something.
To comprehend or grasp the meaning of something.
To stay in place until something happens.
To be in an upright position on one's feet.
To rest one's weight on one's buttocks.
Past tense form of kaun (to eat), indicating completed action.
vocabulary.notes: The prefix 'nag-' indicates past tense for many verbs.

vocabulary.definition: Future tense form of kaun (to eat), indicating action yet to happen.
vocabulary.notes: The prefix 'ma-' indicates future tense for many verbs.
